issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.summary: Android: UI.tableView - OutOfMemoryError after displaying many images
fields.environment:
* Android APIs 2.3.3
* Titanium Mobile 1.8.0.1
* Runtime V8

comments.body:
Thanks for raising this ticket.

In order for me to escalate it to the core team, all the fields must be complete. Please check it against the [JIRA Ticket Checklist|https://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/How+to+Submit+a+Bug+Report#HowtoSubmitaBugReport-JIRATicketChecklist], and add any missing information.  For the description, you can use [this template|https://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/JIRA+Ticket+Template] as a starting point.

Furthermore, we must be able to reproduce the issue in order to accept it, and so a test case must be included and run without modification, as per the [Creating a Test Case|https://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/How+to+Submit+a+Bug+Report#HowtoSubmitaBugReport-CreatingaTestCase] section.

Thanks in advance for your cooperation.

Cheers

Thank you for commenting!
I edited Desription following JIRA Ticket Template.
Please review again.

Hiroki

Did you look at the links I posted?  Note the changes I have made, which involved using the template (cut and pasted it) and the JIRA markup.

The code you have provided is not a test case. Please refer to [Creating a Test Case|https://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/How+to+Submit+a+Bug+Report#HowtoSubmitaBugReport-CreatingaTestCase] for the reasons for this. Please remove all unnecessary code, and try to keep it to a single script. It must run without modification; yours won't, because it does not include an {{app.js}} file.

Thank you

Paul

I'm Sorry, I couldn't create a Test Case.

I modified Test Case and removed all unnecessary code.
So you can run without modification.

Could you try it again, please.

If information is insufficient, I will add more information. 

Thank you.

Personally, I never allow the total size of rendered images to exceed 2MB, whereas your app has rendered a total of 2.8 to 3.2MB at the point that it fails. Thus, you should try releasing imageviews and rows (by nulling the variables) when your app has rendered 60 of your images.

That said, I will pass this to our engineers, in case there is something they can do.

Cheers
I have tested the test case, and can confirm that all the information in this ticket is accurate.

Paul

I read your comment.

Thank you for trying a test case and passing this problem to your engineers!

Paul

I rendered nulling the variables when my app has rendered 60 of your images.
But this problem didn't solve.
my app freezed and didn't work.

So I have no idea to solve this problem.
I'm troubled now.

Although I think you are busy, Could you tell me how is progress now?

Thank you.

I'm unable to reproduce this problem using the 2.1.2 SDK without the above-mentioned fixes.
I'm using the 2.1.2 SDK on a Samsung Galaxy S2 (AT&T) running Android 2.3.6.

Karl
Thank you for commenting.
But I'm not sure your comment. I'm Sorry...
When I tried this test case using the 2.1.2 SDK, I reproduced this problem.
Is your comment's meaning if TIMOB-10712 fixes, this problem also will fix?
I'm not sure relationship for TIMOB-10712 and this problem.

Hiroki:  I'm not able to reproduce in the environment listed above.
What device are you using to test this?  Thanks.

Karl
I tried this test using two devices.
The environment are as follows. 
(I don't have Samsung Galaxy S2, so I couldn't try this test using Samsung Galaxy S2.)

1, Titanium SDK: 2.1.2
   device: Samsung Galaxy S(SC-02B)
   Android: 2.3.3
   ⇒ result: After clicking the footer(Reading more 20 images) about 35 times, the app freezes, the screen goes black and no further images are displayed.

2, Titanium SDK: 2.1.2
   device: Samsung Galaxy S3(SC-06D)
   Android: 4.0.4
   ⇒ result: After clicking the footer(Reading more 20 images) about 5 times, app doesn't seem to freeze, the screen goes black and no further images are displayed.

I reproduced this problem in the two environments listed above.
So could you try again?

Thank you.

I profiled this using DDMS on the Samsung Galaxy S3 running Android 4.1.1.
The heap size grew to about 22 MB and then stabilized.  That's a fairly
large heap, but I haven't seen any evidence that we are leaking memory.
